comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article116272971 ...the digitised newspapers indicate that in the earlier 20th century the Birdsall brothers, and possibly other members of the Birdsall family, were prominent NSW jersey breeders...this 1935 Land pictorial has a pic of Mr A.S. Birdsall's jersey cow 'Pioneer's Snowdrop's Poppy', which looks a bit like the one we see above; nla.gov.au/nla.news-article37701618 or here's Calumet's Countess (1933 Sydney Royal Show winner)... nla.gov.au/nla.news-article118027842 Primrose Day Lady (1926) ...I can't tell one of these cows from the another (!)...the digitised newspapers indicate the Birdsalls also had a few other winners during the 1920s and 1930s...this pic might involve one of those... news.google.com/newspapers?id=Q3lVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=I5YDA... ...here's G. Birdsall's Miama III (1925)...don't think it's her though...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Thanks for picking that up Quasymody re BirdsAll. The writing in the upper right hand corner (upper left when flipped) is very difficult to make out. Seems like two short words, the second ending in 'y' or 'ys'. This wasn't of too much use trawling through Trove though!
